title: Is Discord banned in China? - Quora

response.answer_text: The definition of "harmony" in China is very strange. Why do I feel strange? In my mind, "harmony" means natural harmony, and people live freely. But in the view of the government, "harmony" is not to trouble his management. There is a difference between the two. What is it that makes people think about "freedom"? Is there "absolute freedom"? Proper management is necessary, and of course, there will be contradictions and no perfectionism. (vomit slot, stylistic Entertainment Department sometimes really manage too wide, do not see what contribution you make, only see you are strangling.) Therefore, friends, all acts of confrontation with the government will be severely punished. Keep a low profile.

Yes, it recently got blocked. It is backed by Tencent so the block should only be a couple week at most. Rumor is, Guo Wengui, an exile and suspect in corruption, was using Discord to broadcast right into the mainland. Thus, it was blocked pending investigation.
